alert.note: Alert for Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 10:30AM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Lewis and Mason. In Ohio, Adams, Highland, Hocking, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Logan, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Waverly, Nelsonville, West Union, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Vanceburg, Winchester, Marshall, Sardinia, Seaman, Bainbridge, Kincaid Springs, Pike Lake, Cynthiana and Lucasville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
